   20: 
   21: -module(persistent_term_SUITE).
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0,suite/0,init_per_suite/1,end_per_suite/1,
   25: 	 init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   26: 	 basic/1,purging/1,sharing/1,get_trapping/1,
   27:          destruction/1,
   28:          get_all_race/1,
   29:          info/1,info_trapping/1,killed_while_trapping/1,
   30:          off_heap_values/1,keys/1,collisions/1,
   31:          init_restart/1, put_erase_trapping/1,
   32:          killed_while_trapping_put/1,
   33:          killed_while_trapping_erase/1,
   34:          error_info/1,
   35: 	 whole_message/1,
   36:          shared_magic_ref/1,
   37: 	 non_message_signal/1,
   38:          get_put_colliding_bucket/1]).
   39: 
   40: %%
   41: -export([test_init_restart_cmd/1]).
   42: 
   43: %% Test writing helper
   44: -export([find_colliding_keys/0]).
   45: 
   46: 
   47: suite() ->
   48:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   49:      {timetrap,{minutes,10}}].
   50: 
   51: all() ->
   52:     [basic,purging,sharing,get_trapping,info,info_trapping,
   53:      destruction,
   54:      get_all_race,
   55:      killed_while_trapping,off_heap_values,keys,collisions,
   56:      init_restart, put_erase_trapping, killed_while_trapping_put,
   57:      killed_while_trapping_erase,
   58:      error_info,
   59:      whole_message,
   60:      shared_magic_ref,
   61:      non_message_signal,
   62:      get_put_colliding_bucket].
   63: 
   64: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   65:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
   66:     %% Put a term in the dict so that we know that the testcases handle
   67:     %% stray terms left by stdlib or other test suites.
   68:     persistent_term:put(init_per_suite, {?MODULE}),
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   72:     persistent_term:erase(init_per_suite),
   73:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
   74:     Config.
   75: 
   76: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   77:     Config.
   78: 
   79: end_per_testcase(get_all_race, _Config) ->
   80:     get_all_race_cleanup(),
   81:     ok;
   82: end_per_testcase(_, _Config) ->
   83:     ok.
   84: 
   85: basic(_Config) ->
   86:     Chk = chk(),
   87:     N = 777,
   88:     Seq = lists:seq(1, N),
   89:     par(2, N, Seq, Chk),
   90:     seq(3, Seq, Chk),
   91:     seq(3, Seq, Chk),                                %Same values.
   92:     _ = [begin
   93:              Key = {?MODULE,{key,I}},
   94:              true = persistent_term:erase(Key),
   95:              false = persistent_term:erase(Key),
   96:              {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch persistent_term:get(Key)),
   97:              {not_present,Key} = persistent_term:get(Key, {not_present,Key})
   98:          end || I <- Seq],
   99:     [] = [P || {{?MODULE,_},_}=P <- pget(Chk)],
  100:     chk(Chk).
  101: 
  102: par(C, N, Seq, Chk) ->
  103:     _ = [spawn_link(fun() ->
  104:                             ok = persistent_term:put({?MODULE,{key,I}},
  105:                                                      {value,C*I})
  106:                     end) || I <- Seq],
  107:     Result = wait(N, Chk),
  108:     _ = [begin
  109:              Double = C*I,
  110:              {{?MODULE,{key,I}},{value,Double}} = Res
  111:          end || {I,Res} <- lists:zip(Seq, Result)],
  112:     ok.
  113: 
  114: seq(C, Seq, Chk) ->
  115:     _ = [ok = persistent_term:put({?MODULE,{key,I}}, {value,C*I}) ||
  116:             I <- Seq],
  117:     All = pget(Chk),
  118:     All = [P || {{?MODULE,_},_}=P <- All],
  119:     All = [{Key,persistent_term:get(Key)} || {Key,_} <- All],
  120:     Result = lists:sort(All),
  121:     _ = [begin
  122:              Double = C*I,
  123:              {{?MODULE,{key,I}},{value,Double}} = Res
  124:          end || {I,Res} <- lists:zip(Seq, Result)],
  125:     ok.
  126: 
  127: wait(N, Chk) ->
  128:     All = [P || {{?MODULE,_},_}=P <- pget(Chk)],
  129:     case length(All) of
  130:         N ->
  131:             All = [{Key,persistent_term:get(Key)} || {Key,_} <- All],
  132:             lists:sort(All);
  133:         _ ->
  134:             receive after 10 -> ok end,
  135:             wait(N, Chk)
  136:     end.
  137: 
  138: %% Make sure that terms that have been erased are copied into all
  139: %% processes that still hold a pointer to them.
  140: 
  141: purging(_Config) ->
  142:     Chk = chk(),
  143:     do_purging(fun(K) -> persistent_term:put(K, {?MODULE,new}) end,
  144:                replaced),
  145:     do_purging(fun persistent_term:erase/1, erased),
  146:     chk(Chk).
  147: 
  148: do_purging(Eraser, Type) ->
  149:     Parent = self(),
  150:     Key = {?MODULE,?FUNCTION_NAME},
  151:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key, {term,[<<"abc",0:777/unit:8>>]}),
  152:     Ps0 = [spawn_monitor(fun() -> purging_tester(Parent, Key) end) ||
  153:               _ <- lists:seq(1, 50)],
  154:     Ps = maps:from_list(Ps0),
  155:     purging_recv(gotten, Ps),
  156:     Eraser(Key),
  157:     _ = [P ! {Parent,Type} || P <- maps:keys(Ps)],
  158:     purging_wait(Ps).
  159: 
  160: purging_recv(Tag, Ps) when map_size(Ps) > 0 ->
  161:     receive
  162:         {Pid,Tag} ->
  163:             true = is_map_key(Pid, Ps),
  164:             purging_recv(Tag, maps:remove(Pid, Ps))
  165:     end;
  166: purging_recv(_, _) -> ok.
  167: 
  168: purging_wait(Ps) when map_size(Ps) > 0 ->
  169:     receive
  170:         {'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,Reason} ->
  171:             normal = Reason,
  172:             Ref = map_get(Pid, Ps),
  173:             purging_wait(maps:remove(Pid, Ps))
  174:     end;
  175: purging_wait(_) -> ok.
  176: 
  177: purging_tester(Parent, Key) ->
  178:     Term = persistent_term:get(Key),
  179:     purging_check_term(Term),
  180:     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Term),
  181:     Parent ! {self(),gotten},
  182:     receive
  183:         {Parent,erased} ->
  184:             {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch persistent_term:get(Key)),
  185:             purging_tester_1(Term, 1);
  186:         {Parent,replaced} ->
  187:             {?MODULE,new} = persistent_term:get(Key),
  188:             purging_tester_1(Term, 1)
  189:     end.
  190: 
  191: %% Wait for the term to be copied into this process.
  192: purging_tester_1(Term, Timeout) ->
  193:     purging_check_term(Term),
  194:     receive after Timeout -> ok end,
  195:     case erts_debug:size_shared(Term) of
  196:         0 ->
  197:             case Timeout of
  198:                 1000 ->
  199:                     flush_later_ops(),
  200:                     purging_tester_1(Term, 1);
  201:                 _ ->
  202:                     purging_tester_1(Term, Timeout*10)
  203:             end;
  204:         Size ->
  205:             %% The term has been copied into this process.
  206:             purging_check_term(Term),
  207:             Size = erts_debug:size(Term)
  208:     end.
  209: 
  210: purging_check_term({term,[<<"abc",0:777/unit:8>>]}) ->
  211:     ok.
  212: 
  213: %% Make sure terms are really deallocated when overwritten or erased.
  214: destruction(Config) ->
  215:     ok = erts_test_destructor:init(Config),
  216: 
  217:     NKeys = 100,
  218:     Keys = lists:seq(0,NKeys-1),
  219:     [begin
  220:          V = erts_test_destructor:send(self(), K),
  221:          persistent_term:put({?MODULE,K}, V)
  222:      end
  223:      || K <- Keys],
  224: 
  225:     %% Erase or overwrite all keys in "random" order.
  226:     lists:foldl(fun(_, K) ->
  227:                         case erlang:phash2(K) band 1 of
  228:                             0 ->
  229:                                 %%io:format("erase key ~p\n", [K]),
  230:                                 persistent_term:erase({?MODULE,K});
  231:                             1 ->
  232:                                 %%io:format("replace key ~p\n", [K]),
  233:                                 persistent_term:put({?MODULE,K}, value)
  234:                         end,
  235:                         (K + 13) rem NKeys
  236:                 end,
  237:                 17, Keys),
  238: 
  239:     destruction_1(Keys).
  240: 
  241: destruction_1(Keys) ->
  242:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  243: 
  244:     %% Receive all destruction messages
  245:     MsgLst = destruction_recv(length(Keys), [], 2),
  246:     ok = case lists:sort(MsgLst) of
  247:              Keys ->
  248:                  ok;
  249:              _ ->
  250:                  io:format("GOT ~p\n", [MsgLst]),
  251:                  io:format("MISSING ~p\n", [Keys -- MsgLst]),
  252:                  error
  253:          end,
  254: 
  255:     %% Cleanup all remaining
  256:     [persistent_term:erase({?MODULE,K}) || K <- Keys],
  257:     ok.
  258: 
  259: destruction_recv(0, Acc, _) ->
  260:     Acc;
  261: destruction_recv(N, Acc, Flush) ->
  262:     receive M ->
  263:             destruction_recv(N-1, [M | Acc], Flush)
  264:     after 1000 ->
  265:             io:format("TIMEOUT. Missing ~p destruction messages.\n", [N]),
  266:             case Flush of
  267:                 0 ->
  268:                     Acc;
  269:                 _ ->
  270:                     io:format("Try flush last literal area cleanup...\n"),
  271:                     flush_later_ops(),
  272:                     destruction_recv(N, Acc, Flush-1)
  273:             end
  274:     end.
  275: 
  276: %% Both persistent_term itself and erts_literal_are_collector use
  277: %% erts_schedule_thr_prgr_later_cleanup_op() to schedule purge and deallocation
  278: %% of literals. To avoid waiting forever on sleeping schedulers we flush
  279: %% all later ops to make these cleanup jobs go through.
  280: flush_later_ops() ->
  281:     try
  282:         erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, thread_progress)
  283:     catch
  284:         error:system_limit ->
  285:             ok % already ongoing; called by other process
  286:     end,
  287:     ok.
  288: 
  289: 
  290: %% Test that sharing is preserved when storing terms.
  291: 
  292: sharing(_Config) ->
  293:     Chk = chk(),
  294:     Depth = 10,
  295:     Size = 2*Depth,
  296:     Shared = lists:foldl(fun(_, A) -> [A|A] end,
  297:                          [], lists:seq(1, Depth)),
  298:     Size = erts_debug:size(Shared),
  299:     Key = {?MODULE,?FUNCTION_NAME},
  300:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key, Shared),
  301:     SharedStored = persistent_term:get(Key),
  302:     Size = erts_debug:size(SharedStored),
  303:     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(SharedStored),
  304: 
  305:     {Pid,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
  306:                                       Term = persistent_term:get(Key),
  307:                                       Size = erts_debug:size(Term),
  308:                                       0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Term),
  309:                                       true = Term =:= SharedStored
  310:                               end),
  311:     receive
  312:         {'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,normal} ->
  313:             true = persistent_term:erase(Key),
  314:             Size = erts_debug:size(SharedStored),
  315:             chk(Chk)
  316:     end.
  317: 
  318: %% Test trapping of persistent_term:get/0.
  319: 
  320: get_trapping(_Config) ->
  321:     Chk = chk(),
  322: 
  323:     %% Assume that the get/0 traps after 4000 iterations
  324:     %% in a non-debug emulator.
  325:     N = case test_server:timetrap_scale_factor() of
  326:             1 -> 10000;
  327:             _ -> 1000
  328:         end,
  329:     spawn_link(fun() -> get_trapping_create(N) end),
  330:     All = do_get_trapping(N, [], Chk),
  331:     N = get_trapping_check_result(lists:sort(All), 1),
  332:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  333:     get_trapping_erase(N),
  334:     chk(Chk).
  335: 
  336: do_get_trapping(N, Prev, Chk) ->
  337:     case pget(Chk) of
  338:         Prev when length(Prev) >= N ->
  339:             All = [P || {{?MODULE,{get_trapping,_}},_}=P <- Prev],
  340:             case length(All) of
  341:                 N -> All;
  342:                 _ -> do_get_trapping(N, Prev, Chk)
  343:             end;
  344:         New ->
  345:             receive after 1 -> ok end,
  346:             do_get_trapping(N, New, Chk)
  347:     end.
  348: 
  349: get_trapping_create(0) ->
  350:     ok;
  351: get_trapping_create(N) ->
  352:     ok = persistent_term:put({?MODULE,{get_trapping,N}}, N),
  353:     get_trapping_create(N-1).
  354: 
  355: get_trapping_check_result([{{?MODULE,{get_trapping,N}},N}|T], N) ->
  356:     get_trapping_check_result(T, N+1);
  357: get_trapping_check_result([], N) -> N-1.
  358: 
  359: get_trapping_erase(0) ->
  360:     ok;
  361: get_trapping_erase(N) ->
  362:     true = persistent_term:erase({?MODULE,{get_trapping,N}}),
  363:     get_trapping_erase(N-1).
  364: 
  365: %% Test retrieving information about persistent terms.
  366: 
  367: info(_Config) ->
  368:     Chk = chk(),
  369: 
  370:     %% White box test of info/0.
  371:     N = 100,
  372:     try
  373:         Overhead = info_literal_area_overhead(),
  374:         io:format("Overhead = ~p\n", [Overhead]),
  375:         info_wb(N, Overhead, info_info())
  376:     after
  377:         _ = [_ = persistent_term:erase({?MODULE,I}) ||
  378:                 I <- lists:seq(1, N)]
  379:     end,
  380: 
  381:     chk(Chk).
  382: 
  383: %% White box test of persistent_term:info/0. We take into account
  384: %% that there might already exist persistent terms (created by the
  385: %% OTP standard libraries), but we assume that they are not
  386: %% changed during the execution of this test case.
  387: 
  388: info_wb(0, _, _) ->
  389:     ok;
  390: info_wb(N, Overhead, {BaseCount,BaseMemory}) ->
  391:     Key = {?MODULE,N},
  392:     Value = lists:seq(1, N),
  393:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key, Value),
  394: 
  395:     %% Calculate the extra memory needed for this term.
  396:     WordSize = erlang:system_info(wordsize),
  397:     ExtraMemory = Overhead + 2 * N * WordSize,
  398: 
  399:     %% Call persistent_term:info/0.
  400:     {Count,Memory} = info_info(),
  401: 
  402:     %% There should be one more persistent term.
  403:     Count = BaseCount + 1,
  404: 
  405:     %% Verify that the amount of memory is correct.
  406:     case BaseMemory + ExtraMemory of
  407:         Memory ->
  408:             %% Exactly right. The size of the hash table was not changed.
  409:             ok;
  410:         Expected ->
  411:             %% The size of the hash table has been doubled to avoid filling
  412:             %% the table to more than 50 percent. The previous number
  413:             %% of entries must have been exactly half the size of the
  414:             %% hash table. The expected number of extra words added by
  415:             %% the resizing will be twice that number.
  416:             ExtraWords = BaseCount * 2,
  417:             true = ExtraWords * WordSize =:= (Memory - Expected)
  418:     end,
  419:     info_wb(N-1, Overhead, {Count,Memory}).
  420: 
  421: info_info() ->
  422:     #{count:=Count,memory:=Memory} = persistent_term:info(),
  423:     true = is_integer(Count) andalso Count >= 0,
  424:     true = is_integer(Memory) andalso Memory >= 0,
  425:     {Count,Memory}.
  426: 
  427: %% Calculate the number of extra bytes needed for storing each term in
  428: %% the literal, assuming that the key is a tuple of size 2 with
  429: %% immediate elements. The calculated number is the size of the
  430: %% ErtsLiteralArea struct excluding the storage for the literal term
  431: %% itself.
  432: 
  433: info_literal_area_overhead() ->
  434:     Key1 = {?MODULE,1},
  435:     Key2 = {?MODULE,2},
  436:     #{memory:=Mem0} = persistent_term:info(),
  437:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key1, literal),
  438:     #{memory:=Mem1} = persistent_term:info(),
  439:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key2, literal),
  440:     #{memory:=Mem2} = persistent_term:info(),
  441:     true = persistent_term:erase(Key1),
  442:     true = persistent_term:erase(Key2),
  443: 
  444:     %% The size of the hash table may have doubled when inserting
  445:     %% one of the keys. To avoiding counting the change in the hash
  446:     %% table size, take the smaller size increase.
  447:     min(Mem2-Mem1, Mem1-Mem0).
  448: 
  449: %% Test trapping of persistent_term:info/0.
  450: 
  451: info_trapping(_Config) ->
  452:     Chk = chk(),
  453: 
  454:     %% Assume that the info/0 traps after 4000 iterations
  455:     %% in a non-debug emulator.
  456:     N = case test_server:timetrap_scale_factor() of
  457:             1 -> 10000;
  458:             _ -> 1000
  459:         end,
  460:     spawn_link(fun() -> info_trapping_create(N) end),
  461:     All = do_info_trapping(N, 0, Chk),
  462:     N = info_trapping_check_result(lists:sort(All), 1),
  463:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  464:     info_trapping_erase(N),
  465:     chk(Chk).
  466: 
  467: do_info_trapping(N, PrevMem, Chk) ->
  468:     case info_info() of
  469:         {M,Mem} when M >= N ->
  470:             true = Mem >= PrevMem,
  471:             All = [P || {{?MODULE,{info_trapping,_}},_}=P <- pget(Chk)],
  472:             case length(All) of
  473:                 N -> All;
  474:                 _ -> do_info_trapping(N, PrevMem, Chk)
  475:             end;
  476:         {_,Mem} ->
  477:             true = Mem >= PrevMem,
  478:             receive after 1 -> ok end,
  479:             do_info_trapping(N, Mem, Chk)
  480:     end.
  481: 
  482: info_trapping_create(0) ->
  483:     ok;
  484: info_trapping_create(N) ->
  485:     ok = persistent_term:put({?MODULE,{info_trapping,N}}, N),
  486:     info_trapping_create(N-1).
  487: 
  488: info_trapping_check_result([{{?MODULE,{info_trapping,N}},N}|T], N) ->
  489:     info_trapping_check_result(T, N+1);
  490: info_trapping_check_result([], N) -> N-1.
  491: 
  492: info_trapping_erase(0) ->
  493:     ok;
  494: info_trapping_erase(N) ->
  495:     true = persistent_term:erase({?MODULE,{info_trapping,N}}),
  496:     info_trapping_erase(N-1).
  497: 
  498: %% Test that hash tables are deallocated if a process running
  499: %% persistent_term:get/0 is killed.
  500: 
  501: killed_while_trapping(_Config) ->
  502:     Chk = chk(),
  503:     N = case test_server:timetrap_scale_factor() of
  504:             1 -> 20000;
  505:             _ -> 2000
  506:         end,
  507:     kwt_put(N),
  508:     kwt_spawn(10),
  509:     kwt_erase(N),
  510:     chk(Chk).
  511: 
  512: kwt_put(0) ->
  513:     ok;
  514: kwt_put(N) ->
  515:     ok = persistent_term:put({?MODULE,{kwt,N}}, N),
  516:     kwt_put(N-1).
  517: 
  518: kwt_spawn(0) ->
  519:     ok;
  520: kwt_spawn(N) ->
  521:     Pids = [spawn(fun kwt_getter/0) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 20)],
  522:     erlang:yield(),
  523:     _ = [exit(Pid, kill) || Pid <- Pids],
  524:     kwt_spawn(N-1).
  525: 
  526: kwt_getter() ->
  527:     _ = persistent_term:get(),
  528:     kwt_getter().
  529: 
  530: kwt_erase(0) ->
  531:     ok;
  532: kwt_erase(N) ->
  533:     true = persistent_term:erase({?MODULE,{kwt,N}}),
  534:     kwt_erase(N-1).
  535: 
  536: %% Test storing off heap values (such as ref-counted binaries).
  537: 
  538: off_heap_values(_Config) ->
  539:     Chk = chk(),
  540:     Key = {?MODULE,?FUNCTION_NAME},
  541:     Val = {a,list_to_binary(lists:seq(0, 255)),make_ref(),fun() -> ok end},
  542:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key, Val),
  543:     FetchedVal = persistent_term:get(Key),
  544:     Val = FetchedVal,
  545:     true = persistent_term:erase(Key),
  546:     off_heap_values_wait(FetchedVal, Val),
  547:     chk(Chk).
  548: 
  549: off_heap_values_wait(FetchedVal, Val) ->
  550:     case erts_debug:size_shared(FetchedVal) of
  551:         0 ->
  552:             Val = FetchedVal,
  553:             ok;
  554:         _ ->
  555:             erlang:yield(),
  556:             off_heap_values_wait(FetchedVal, Val)
  557:     end.
  558: 
  559: %% Test some more data types as keys. Use the module name as a key
  560: %% to minimize the risk of collision with any key used
  561: %% by the OTP libraries.
  562: 
  563: keys(_Config) ->
  564:     Chk = chk(),
  565:     do_key(?MODULE),
  566:     do_key([?MODULE]),
  567:     do_key(?MODULE_STRING),
  568:     do_key(list_to_binary(?MODULE_STRING)),
  569:     chk(Chk).
  570: 
  571: do_key(Key) ->
  572:     Val = term_to_binary(Key),
  573:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key, Val),
  574:     StoredVal = persistent_term:get(Key),
  575:     Val = StoredVal,
  576:     true = persistent_term:erase(Key).
  577: 
  578: %% Create persistent terms with keys that are known to collide.
  579: %% Delete them in random order, making sure that all others
  580: %% terms can still be found.
  581: 
  582: collisions(_Config) ->
  583:     Chk = chk(),
  584: 
  585:     %% Create persistent terms with random keys.
  586:     Keys = lists:flatten(colliding_keys()),
  587:     Kvs = [{K,rand:uniform(1000)} || K <- Keys],
  588:     _ = [ok = persistent_term:put(K, V) || {K,V} <- Kvs],
  589:     _ = [V = persistent_term:get(K) || {K,V} <- Kvs],
  590: 
  591:     %% Now delete the persistent terms in random order.
  592:     collisions_delete(lists:keysort(2, Kvs), Chk),
  593: 
  594:     chk(Chk).
  595: 
  596: collisions_delete([{Key,Val}|Kvs], Chk) ->
  597:     Val = persistent_term:get(Key),
  598:     true = persistent_term:erase(Key),
  599:     true = lists:sort(pget(Chk)) =:= lists:sort(Kvs),
  600:     _ = [V = persistent_term:get(K) || {K,V} <- Kvs],
  601:     collisions_delete(Kvs, Chk);
  602: collisions_delete([], _) ->
  603:     ok.
  604: 
  605: colliding_keys() ->
  606:     %% Collisions found by find_colliding_keys() below
  607:     %%    ct:timetrap({minutes, 60}),
  608:     %%    ct:pal("Colliding keys = ~p", [find_colliding_keys()]),
  609:     Collisions =
  610:         #{
  611:             %% Collisions for Jenkins96 hashing.
  612:             1268203079 => [[77674392,148027],
  613:                            [103370644,950908],
  614:                            [106444046,870178],
  615:                            [22217246,735880],
  616:                            [18088843,694607],
  617:                            [63426007,612179],
  618:                            [117354942,906431],
  619:                            [121434305,94282311,816072],
  620:                            [118441466,93873772,783366],
  621:                            [124338174,1414801,123089],
  622:                            [20240282,17113486,923647],
  623:                            [126495528,61463488,164994],
  624:                            [125341723,5729072,445539],
  625:                            [127450932,80442669,348245],
  626:                            [123354692,85724182,14241288,180793],
  627:                            [99159367,65959274,61680971,289939],
  628:                            [107637580,104512101,62639807,181644],
  629:                            [139547511,51654420,2062545,151944],
  630:                            [88078274,73031465,53388204,428872],
  631:                            [141314238,75761379,55699508,861797],
  632:                            [88045216,59272943,21030492,180903]],
  633:             %% Collisions for CRC32-C hashing.
  634:             1982459178 => [[-4294967296,654663773],
  635:                            [-3758096384,117792861],
  636:                            [-3221225472,1728405597],
  637:                            [-2684354560,1191534685],
  638:                            [-2147483648,2706162303],
  639:                            [-1610612736,2169291391],
  640:                            [-1073741824,3779904127],
  641:                            [-536870912,3243033215],
  642:                            [-3640303523,0],
  643:                            [-4177174435,536870912],
  644:                            [-2566561699,1073741824],
  645:                            [-3103432611,1610612736],
  646:                            [-1588804993,2147483648],
  647:                            [-2125675905,2684354560],
  648:                            [-515063169,3221225472],
  649:                            [-1051934081,3758096384]]
  650:         },
  651: 
  652:     Key = internal_hash(2),
  653:     ct:pal("internal_hash(2) = ~p", [Key]),
  654:     #{ Key := L } = Collisions,
  655: 
  656:     %% Verify that the keys still collide (this will fail if the
  657:     %% internal hash function has been changed).
  658:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  659:         8 ->
  660:             verify_colliding_keys(L);
  661:         4 ->
  662:             %% Not guaranteed to collide on a 32-bit system.
  663:             ok
  664:     end,
  665: 
  666:     L.
  667: 
  668: verify_colliding_keys([[K|Ks]|Gs]) ->
  669:     Hash = internal_hash(K),
  670:     [Hash] = lists:usort([internal_hash(Key) || Key <- Ks]),
  671:     verify_colliding_keys(Gs);
  672: verify_colliding_keys([]) ->
  673:     ok.
  674: 
  675: internal_hash(Term) ->
  676:     erts_debug:get_internal_state({internal_hash,Term}).
  677: 
  678: %% Use this function to (re)generate the list in colliding_keys/0
  679: %%
  680: %% Grab a coffee, it will take a while.
  681: find_colliding_keys() ->
  682:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  683:     NumScheds = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  684:     Start = -(1 bsl 32),
  685:     End = -Start,
  686:     Range = End - Start,
  687:     Step = Range div NumScheds,
  688:     timer:tc(fun() -> fck_spawn(NumScheds, NumScheds, Start, End, Step, []) end).
  689: 
  690: fck_spawn(0, _NumScheds, _Start, _End, _Step, Refs) ->
  691:     fck_await(Refs);
  692: fck_spawn(N, NumScheds, Start, End, Step, Refs) ->
  693:     Key = Start + (N - 1) * Step,
  694:     {_, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> exit(fck_finder(Start, End, Key)) end),
  695:     fck_spawn(N - 1, NumScheds, Start, End, Step, [Ref | Refs]).
  696: 
  697: fck_await([Ref | Refs]) ->
  698:     receive
  699:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, [_Initial]} ->
  700:             %% Ignore slices where the initial value only collided with itself.
  701:             fck_await(Refs);
  702:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, Collisions} ->
  703:             [Collisions | fck_await(Refs)]
  704:     end;
  705: fck_await([]) ->
  706:     [].
  707: 
  708: fck_finder(Start, End, Key) ->
  709:     true = Key >= Start, true = Key < End,      %Assertion.
  710:     fck_finder_1(Start, End, internal_hash(Key)).
  711: 
  712: fck_finder_1(Same, Same, _Target) ->
  713:     [];
  714: fck_finder_1(Next, End, Target) ->
  715:     case internal_hash(Next) =:= Target of
  716:         true -> [Next | fck_finder_1(Next + 1, End, Target)];
  717:         false -> fck_finder_1(Next + 1, End, Target)
  718:     end.
  719: 
  720: %% OTP-17700 Bug skipped refc++ of shared magic reference
  721: shared_magic_ref(_Config) ->
  722:     Ref = atomics:new(10, []),
  723:     persistent_term:put(shared_magic_ref, {Ref, Ref}),
  724:     shared_magic_ref_cont().
  725: 
  726: shared_magic_ref_cont() ->
  727:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  728:     {Ref, Ref} = persistent_term:get(shared_magic_ref),
  729:     0 = atomics:get(Ref, 1),  %% would definitely fail on debug vm
  730:     ok.
  731: 
  732: 
  733: %% Test that all persistent terms are erased by init:restart/0.
  734: 
  735: init_restart(_Config) ->
  736:     File = "command_file",
  737:     ok = file:write_file(File, term_to_binary(restart)),
  738:     {ok,[[Erl]]} = init:get_argument(progname),
  739:     ModPath = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  740:     Cmd = Erl ++ " -pa " ++ ModPath ++ " -noshell "
  741:         "-run " ++ ?MODULE_STRING ++ " test_init_restart_cmd " ++
  742:         File,
  743:     io:format("~s\n", [Cmd]),
  744:     Expected = "12ok",
  745:     case os:cmd(Cmd) of
  746:         Expected ->
  747:             ok;
  748:         Actual ->
  749:             io:format("Expected: ~s", [Expected]),
  750:             io:format("Actual:   ~s\n", [Actual]),
  751:             ct:fail(unexpected_output)
  752:     end.
  753: 
  754: test_init_restart_cmd([File]) ->
  755:     try
  756:         do_test_init_restart_cmd(File)
  757:     catch
  758:         C:R ->
  759:             io:format("\n~p ~p\n", [C,R]),
  760:             halt()
  761:     end,
  762:     receive
  763:         _ -> ok
  764:     end.
  765: 
  766: do_test_init_restart_cmd(File) ->
  767:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File),
  768:     Seq = lists:seq(1, 50),
  769:     case binary_to_term(Bin) of
  770:         restart ->
  771:             _ = [persistent_term:put({?MODULE,I}, {value,I}) ||
  772:                     I <- Seq],
  773:             ok = file:write_file(File, term_to_binary(was_restarted)),
  774:             io:put_chars("1"),
  775:             init:restart(),
  776:             receive
  777:                 _ -> ok
  778:             end;
  779:         was_restarted ->
  780:             io:put_chars("2"),
  781:             ok = file:delete(File),
  782:             _ = [begin
  783:                      Key = {?MODULE,I},
  784:                      {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch persistent_term:get(Key))
  785:                  end || I <- Seq],
  786:             io:put_chars("ok"),
  787:             init:stop()
  788:     end.
  789: 
  790: %% Test that the literal is copied when removed also when
  791: %% the whole message is a literal...
  792: 
  793: whole_message(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  794:     whole_message_test(on_heap),
  795:     whole_message_test(off_heap),
  796:     ok.
  797:     
  798: whole_message_test(MQD) ->
  799:     io:format("Testing on ~p~n", [MQD]),
  800:     Go = make_ref(),
  801:     Done = make_ref(),
  802:     TestRef = make_ref(),
  803:     Tester = self(),
  804:     persistent_term:put(test_ref, TestRef),
  805:     Pid = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  806:                              receive Go -> ok end,
  807:                              receive TestRef -> ok end,
  808:                              receive TestRef -> ok end,
  809:                              receive TestRef -> ok end,
  810:                              receive [TestRef] -> ok end,
  811:                              receive [TestRef] -> ok end,
  812:                              receive [TestRef] -> ok end,
  813:                              Tester ! Done
  814:                      end, [link, {message_queue_data, MQD}]),
  815:     Pid ! persistent_term:get(test_ref),
  816:     Pid ! persistent_term:get(test_ref),
  817:     Pid ! persistent_term:get(test_ref),
  818:     %% Throw in some messages with a reference from the heap
  819:     %% while we're at it...
  820:     Pid ! [persistent_term:get(test_ref)],
  821:     Pid ! [persistent_term:get(test_ref)],
  822:     Pid ! [persistent_term:get(test_ref)],
  823:     persistent_term:erase(test_ref),
  824:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  825:     Pid ! Go,
  826:     receive Done -> ok end,
  827:     unlink(Pid),
  828:     exit(Pid, kill),
  829:     false = is_process_alive(Pid),
  830:     ok.
  831: 
  832: %% Check that there is the same number of persistents terms before
  833: %% and after each test case.
  834: 
  835: chk() ->
  836:     {xtra_info(), persistent_term:get()}.
  837: 
  838: chk({Info1, _Initial} = Chk) ->
  839:     #{count := Count, memory := Memory1, table := Table1} = Info1,
  840:     case xtra_info() of
  841:         Info1 ->
  842:             ok;
  843:         #{count := Count, memory := Memory2, table := Table2}=Info2
  844:           when Memory2 > Memory1,
  845:                Table2 > Table1 ->
  846:             %% Check increased memory is only table growth hysteresis
  847:             MemDiff = Memory2 - Memory1,
  848:             TabDiff = (Table2 - Table1) * erlang:system_info(wordsize),
  849:             {MemDiff,MemDiff} = {MemDiff, TabDiff},
  850: 
  851:             case (Count / Table2) of
  852:                 Load when Load >= 0.25 ->
  853:                     ok;
  854:                 _ ->
  855:                     chk_fail("Hash table too large", Info1, Info2)
  856:             end;
  857:         Info2 ->
  858:             chk_fail("Memory diff", Info1, Info2)
  859:     end,
  860:     Key = {?MODULE,?FUNCTION_NAME},
  861:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key, {term,Info1}),
  862:     Term = persistent_term:get(Key),
  863:     true = persistent_term:erase(Key),
  864:     chk_not_stuck(Term, 1),
  865:     [persistent_term:erase(K) || {K, _} <- pget(Chk)],
  866:     ok.
  867: 
  868: xtra_info() ->
  869:     maps:merge(persistent_term:info(),
  870:                erts_debug:get_internal_state(persistent_term)).
  871: 
  872: chk_fail(Error, Info1, Info2) ->
  873:     io:format("Info1 = ~p\n", [Info1]),
  874:     io:format("Info2 = ~p\n", [Info2]),
  875:     ct:fail(Error).
  876: 
  877: chk_not_stuck(Term, Timeout) ->
  878:     %% Hash tables to be deleted are put onto a queue.
  879:     %% Make sure that the queue isn't stuck by a table with
  880:     %% a non-zero ref count.
  881: 
  882:     case erts_debug:size_shared(Term) of
  883:         0 ->
  884:             receive after Timeout -> ok end,
  885:             case Timeout of
  886:                 1000 ->
  887:                     flush_later_ops(),
  888:                     chk_not_stuck(Term, 1);
  889:                 _ ->
  890:                     chk_not_stuck(Term, Timeout*10)
  891:             end;
  892:         _ ->
  893:             ok
  894:     end.
  895: 
  896: pget({_, Initial}) ->
  897:     persistent_term:get() -- Initial.
  898: 
  899: 
  900: killed_while_trapping_put(_Config) ->
  901:     repeat(
  902:       fun() ->
  903:               NrOfPutsInChild = 10000,
  904:               do_puts(2500, my_value),
  905:               Pid =
  906:                   spawn(fun() ->
  907:                                 do_puts(NrOfPutsInChild, my_value2)
  908:                         end),
  909:               timer:sleep(1),
  910:               erlang:exit(Pid, kill),
  911:               do_erases(NrOfPutsInChild)
  912:       end,
  913:       10),
  914:     ok.
  915: 
  916: killed_while_trapping_erase(_Config) ->
  917:     repeat(
  918:       fun() ->
  919:               NrOfErases = 2500,
  920:               do_puts(NrOfErases, my_value),
  921:               Pid =
  922:                   spawn(fun() ->
  923:                                 do_erases(NrOfErases)
  924:                         end),
  925:               timer:sleep(1),
  926:               erlang:exit(Pid, kill),
  927:               do_erases(NrOfErases)
  928:       end,
  929:       10),
  930:     ok.
  931: 
  932: put_erase_trapping(_Config) ->
  933:     NrOfItems = 5000,
  934:     do_puts(NrOfItems, first),
  935:     do_puts(NrOfItems, second),
  936:     do_erases(NrOfItems),
  937:     ok.
  938: 
  939: do_puts(0, _) -> ok;
  940: do_puts(NrOfPuts, ValuePrefix) ->
  941:     Key = {?MODULE, NrOfPuts},
  942:     Value = {ValuePrefix, NrOfPuts},
  943:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, rand:uniform(250)),
  944:     persistent_term:put(Key, Value),
  945:     Value = persistent_term:get(Key),
  946:     do_puts(NrOfPuts - 1, ValuePrefix).
  947: 
  948: do_erases(0) -> ok;
  949: do_erases(NrOfErases) ->
  950:     Key = {?MODULE,NrOfErases},
  951:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, rand:uniform(500)),
  952:     persistent_term:erase(Key),
  953:     not_found = persistent_term:get(Key, not_found),
  954:     do_erases(NrOfErases - 1).
  955: 
  956: repeat(_Fun, 0) ->
  957:     ok;
  958: repeat(Fun, N) ->
  959:     Fun(),
  960:     repeat(Fun, N-1).
  961: 
  962: error_info(_Config) ->
  963:     L = [{erase, [{?MODULE,my_key}], [no_fail]},
  964:          {get, [{?MODULE,certainly_not_existing}]},
  965:          {get, [{?MODULE,certainly_not_existing}, default], [no_fail]},
  966:          {put, 2}                               %Can't fail.
  967:         ],
  968:     do_error_info(L).
  969: 
  970: do_error_info(L0) ->
  971:     L1 = lists:foldl(fun({_,A}, Acc) when is_integer(A) -> Acc;
  972:                         ({F,A}, Acc) -> [{F,A,[]}|Acc];
  973:                         ({F,A,Opts}, Acc) -> [{F,A,Opts}|Acc]
  974:                      end, [], L0),
  975:     Tests = ordsets:from_list([{F,length(A)} || {F,A,_} <- L1] ++
  976:                                   [{F,A} || {F,A} <- L0, is_integer(A)]),
  977:     Bifs0 = [{F,A} || {F,A} <- persistent_term:module_info(exports),
  978:                       A =/= 0,
  979:                       F =/= module_info],
  980:     Bifs = ordsets:from_list(Bifs0),
  981:     NYI = [{F,lists:duplicate(A, '*'),nyi} || {F,A} <- Bifs -- Tests],
  982:     L = lists:sort(NYI ++ L1),
  983:     do_error_info(L, []).
  984: 
  985: do_error_info([{_,Args,nyi}=H|T], Errors) ->
  986:     case lists:all(fun(A) -> A =:= '*' end, Args) of
  987:         true ->
  988:             do_error_info(T, [{nyi,H}|Errors]);
  989:         false ->
  990:             do_error_info(T, [{bad_nyi,H}|Errors])
  991:     end;
  992: do_error_info([{F,Args,Opts}|T], Errors) ->
  993:     eval_bif_error(F, Args, Opts, T, Errors);
  994: do_error_info([], Errors0) ->
  995:     case lists:sort(Errors0) of
  996:         [] ->
  997:             ok;
  998:         [_|_]=Errors ->
  999:             io:format("\n~p\n", [Errors]),
 1000:             ct:fail({length(Errors),errors})
 1001:     end.
 1002: 
 1003: eval_bif_error(F, Args, Opts, T, Errors0) ->
 1004:     try apply(persistent_term, F, Args) of
 1005:         Result ->
 1006:             case lists:member(no_fail, Opts) of
 1007:                 true ->
 1008:                     do_error_info(T, Errors0);
 1009:                 false ->
 1010:                     do_error_info(T, [{should_fail,{F,Args},Result}|Errors0])
 1011:             end
 1012:     catch
 1013:         error:Reason:Stk ->
 1014:             SF = fun(Mod, _, _) -> Mod =:= test_server end,
 1015:             Str = erl_error:format_exception(error, Reason, Stk, #{stack_trim_fun => SF}),
 1016:             BinStr = iolist_to_binary(Str),
 1017:             ArgStr = lists:join(", ", [io_lib:format("~p", [A]) || A <- Args]),
 1018:             io:format("\nerlang:~p(~s)\n~ts", [F,ArgStr,BinStr]),
 1019: 
 1020:             case Stk of
 1021:                 [{persistent_term,ActualF,ActualArgs,Info}|_] ->
 1022:                     RE = <<"[*][*][*] argument \\d+:">>,
 1023:                     Errors1 = case re:run(BinStr, RE, [{capture, none}]) of
 1024:                                   match ->
 1025:                                       Errors0;
 1026:                                   nomatch when Reason =:= system_limit ->
 1027:                                       Errors0;
 1028:                                   nomatch ->
 1029:                                       [{no_explanation,{F,Args},Info}|Errors0]
 1030:                               end,
 1031: 
 1032:                     Errors = case {ActualF,ActualArgs} of
 1033:                                  {F,Args} ->
 1034:                                      Errors1;
 1035:                                  _ ->
 1036:                                      [{renamed,{F,length(Args)},{ActualF,ActualArgs}}|Errors1]
 1037:                              end,
 1038: 
 1039:                     do_error_info(T, Errors);
 1040:                 _ ->
 1041:                     Errors = [{renamed,{F,length(Args)},hd(Stk)}|Errors0],
 1042:                     do_error_info(T, Errors)
 1043:             end
 1044:     end.
 1045: 
 1046: 
 1047: %% OTP-17298
 1048: get_all_race(_Config) ->
 1049:     N = 20 * erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 1050:     persistent_term:put(get_all_race, N),
 1051:     SPs = [spawn_link(fun() -> gar_setter(Seq) end) || Seq <- lists:seq(1, N)],
 1052:     GPs = [spawn_link(fun gar_getter/0) || _ <- lists:seq(1, N)],
 1053:     receive after 2000 -> ok end,
 1054:     [begin unlink(Pid), exit(Pid,kill) end || Pid <- (SPs ++ GPs)],
 1055:     ok.
 1056: 
 1057: get_all_race_cleanup() ->
 1058:     N = persistent_term:get(get_all_race, 0),
 1059:     _ = persistent_term:erase(get_all_race),
 1060:     [_ = persistent_term:erase(Seq) || Seq <- lists:seq(1, N)],
 1061:     ok.
 1062: 
 1063: gar_getter() ->
 1064:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, 1),
 1065:     _ = persistent_term:get(),
 1066:     gar_getter().
 1067: 
 1068: gar_setter(Key) ->
 1069:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, 1),
 1070:     persistent_term:erase(Key),
 1071:     persistent_term:put(Key, {complex, term}),
 1072:     gar_setter(Key).
 1073: 
 1074: %% Test that literals in non-message signals are copied
 1075: %% when removed...
 1076: %%
 1077: %% Currently the only non-message signal that may carry
 1078: %% literals are alias-message signals. Exit signals have
 1079: %% been added to the test since they should be added
 1080: %% next...
 1081: 
 1082: non_message_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1083:     non_message_signal_test(on_heap),
 1084:     non_message_signal_test(off_heap),
 1085:     ok.
 1086: 
 1087: non_message_signal_test(MQD) ->
 1088:     io:format("Testing on ~p~n", [MQD]),
 1089:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 1090:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1091:     MultiSched = erlang:system_info(schedulers) > 1,
 1092:     {TokOpts, RecvOpts}
 1093:         = case MultiSched of
 1094:               true ->
 1095:                   {[link, {scheduler, 2}, {priority, high}],
 1096:                    [link, {scheduler, 2}, {priority, low},
 1097: 		    {message_queue_data, MQD}]};
 1098:               false ->
 1099:                   {[link], [link, {message_queue_data, MQD}]}
 1100:           end,
 1101:     RecvPrepared = make_ref(),
 1102:     TokPrepared = make_ref(),
 1103:     Go = make_ref(),
 1104:     Done = make_ref(),
 1105:     TestRef = make_ref(),
 1106:     Tester = self(),
 1107:     persistent_term:put(test_ref, TestRef),
 1108:     Pid = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1109: 			    process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1110:                             Tester ! {RecvPrepared, alias()},
 1111:                             receive Go -> ok end,
 1112: 			    recv_msg(TestRef, 50),
 1113: 			    recv_msg([TestRef], 50),
 1114:                             recv_msg({'EXIT', Tester, TestRef}, 50),
 1115:                             recv_msg({'EXIT', Tester, [TestRef]}, 50),
 1116:                             Tester ! Done
 1117:                     end, RecvOpts),
 1118:     Alias = receive {RecvPrepared, A} -> A end,
 1119:     Tok = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1120:                             Tester ! TokPrepared,
 1121:                             tok_loop()
 1122:                     end, TokOpts),
 1123:     receive TokPrepared -> ok end,
 1124:     lists:foreach(fun (_) -> Alias ! persistent_term:get(test_ref) end,
 1125: 		  lists:seq(1, 50)),
 1126:     lists:foreach(fun (_) -> Alias ! [persistent_term:get(test_ref)] end,
 1127: 		  lists:seq(1, 50)),
 1128:     lists:foreach(fun (_) -> exit(Pid, persistent_term:get(test_ref)) end,
 1129: 		  lists:seq(1, 50)),
 1130:     lists:foreach(fun (_) -> exit(Pid, [persistent_term:get(test_ref)]) end,
 1131: 		  lists:seq(1, 50)),
 1132:     persistent_term:erase(test_ref),
 1133:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1134:     unlink(Tok),
 1135:     exit(Tok, kill),
 1136:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1137:     Pid ! Go,
 1138:     receive Done -> ok end,
 1139:     unlink(Pid),
 1140:     exit(Pid, kill),
 1141:     false = is_process_alive(Pid),
 1142:     false = is_process_alive(Tok),
 1143:     ok.
 1144: 
 1145: recv_msg(_Msg, 0) ->
 1146:     ok;
 1147: recv_msg(Msg, N) ->
 1148:     receive
 1149:         Msg ->
 1150:             recv_msg(Msg, N-1)
 1151:     end.
 1152: 
 1153: tok_loop() ->
 1154:     tok_loop().
 1155: 
 1156: %% GH-5908: `persistent_term:get/1,2` could race with `persistent_term:put/2`
 1157: %% and return an unexpected value if `get/1,2` happened to _abort_ its lookup
 1158: %% in the same bucket that `put/2` was writing to.
 1159: get_put_colliding_bucket(_Config) ->
 1160:     [[Key, CollidesWith | _] | _] = colliding_keys(),
 1161:     false = persistent_term:erase(Key),
 1162: 
 1163:     {Pid, MRef} =
 1164:         spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1165:                               Schedulers = erlang:system_info(schedulers),
 1166:                               [spawn_link(fun() -> gpcb_reader(Key) end)
 1167:                                || _ <- lists:seq(1, Schedulers - 1)],
 1168:                               gpcb_updater(CollidesWith)
 1169:                       end),
 1170: 
 1171:     %% The race usually gets detected within a second or two, so we'll consider
 1172:     %% the test passed if we can't reproduce it in 10 seconds.
 1173:     receive
 1174:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 1175:             ct:fail(Reason)
 1176:     after 10000 ->
 1177:             exit(Pid, kill),
 1178:             ok
 1179:     end.
 1180: 
 1181: gpcb_reader(Key) ->
 1182:     expected = persistent_term:get(Key, expected),
 1183:     gpcb_reader(Key).
 1184: 
 1185: gpcb_updater(CollidesWith) ->
 1186:     persistent_term:erase(CollidesWith),
 1187:     persistent_term:put(CollidesWith, unexpected),
 1188:     gpcb_updater(CollidesWith).
